div: If you want to use TEAM Mentor locally only, use Cassini. If you want to expose the TEAM Mentor on a web server to your team, use IIS.

To run TEAM Mentor locally, there is no installation needed, once the TEAM Mentor files are available locally, the only step required is to start the Cassini web server using the provided batch file. SSL certificate is not required when connecting to TEAM Mentor instance running on "localhost".

Copy TEAM Mentor files to local folder
Download the .zip file of TEAM Mentor and extract itYou can also do a Git Clone of the desired version of TEAM Mentor from GitHub
      
        The TEAM Mentor root folder should contain the following folders:
DocsToolsWeb ApplicationsLibrary_Data (Note: Only the zip file will have this 
directory, for TM cloned from GitHub this directory will automatically 
be created on first run of TM)
      (Optional) Set the local TEAM Mentor portOpen the "start webserver.bat" file with a text editor.Edit the "/port" argument in the following line:
start "WebServer" "WebServer/CassiniDev.exe" /port:12345 /portMode:Specific /path:"Web Applications\TM_Website"Set same port on the next line
start http://127.0.0.1:12345
      
        Start local WebServer (using batch file)
Double-click on the "start webserver.bat" file to start the web server on the defined portThe default web browser should open automatically with the TEAM Mentor web site

b: Set the local TEAM Mentor port

html:
If you want to use TEAM Mentor locally only, use Cassini. If you want to expose the TEAM Mentor on a web server to your team, use IIS. 

To run TEAM Mentor locally, there is no installation needed, once the TEAM Mentor files are available locally, the only step required is to start the Cassini web server using the provided batch file. SSL certificate is not required when connecting to TEAM Mentor instance running on "localhost".
  1. Copy TEAM Mentor files to local folder
    • Download the .zip file of TEAM Mentor and extract it
    • You can also do a Git Clone of the desired version of TEAM Mentor from GitHub

  2. The TEAM Mentor root folder should contain the following folders:
    • Docs
    • Tools
    • Web Applications
    • Library_Data (Note: Only the zip file will have this directory, for TM cloned from GitHub this directory will automatically be created on first run of TM)

  3. (Optional) Set the local TEAM Mentor port
    • Open the "start webserver.bat" file with a text editor.
    • Edit the "/port" argument in the following line:
      • start "WebServer" "WebServer/CassiniDev.exe" /port:12345 /portMode:Specific /path:"Web Applications\TM_Website"
    • Set same port on the next line
      • start http://127.0.0.1:12345

  4. Start local WebServer (using batch file)
    • Double-click on the "start webserver.bat" file to start the web server on the defined port
    • The default web browser should open automatically with the TEAM Mentor web site
